001.comments: This course is formerly KIN 389. Students can receive credit for either KIN 389 or KIN 313

0W1.comments: When wait-lists are used, it is STUDENTS' RESPONSIBILITY to check the SSC for changes made to their registration.This course is formerly KIN 389 . Students can receive credit for either KIN 389 or KIN 313

description: The neurophysiological and functional neuroanatomical processes involved in the sensory and motor control of movement, posture and balance in the human. Peripheral and central sensorimotor structures, and neurological diseases that affect human movement and balance control will be discussed.
